snippet: The firm, Ameridose, has some of the same owners as the pharmacy whose tainted steroid caused a nationwide outbreak of fungal meningitis.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration investigation finds long list of unsanitary conditions and unsafe practices at Ameridose, drug supplier with some same owners as pharmacy whose tainted steroid caused nationwide outbreak of fungal meningitis that killed 32 people and sickened more than 400 others.from patients.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY and SABRINA TAVERNISE

lead_paragraph: The firm, Ameridose, has some of the same owners as the pharmacy whose tainted steroid caused a nationwide outbreak of fungal meningitis.

headline.seo: Safety Problems Found at Firm Tied to Meningitis-Linked Pharmacy
headline.main: F.D.A. Finds Safety Problems at Company Supplying Drugs
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Finds Safety Problems At Company Supplying Drugs
